SENT.plain: Transient ischemic attacks have been attributed to emboli from the external carotid artery in patients with complete occlusion of the internal carotid artery
We report a patient with an external carotid stenosis and normal internal carotid who developed ipsilateral transient ischemic attacks
Real time B-mode ultrasonography demonstrated that the plaque obstructing the external carotid artery extended into the carotid sinus
This may have served as a source of emboli into the internal carotid circulation
